00049 #define ARROW_ERROR_NON_FATAL -2
00050 #define ARROW_TRUE 1
00051 #define ARROW_FALSE 0

00054 #define ARROW_BTSP_SOLVE_PLAN_CONSTRAINED 2
00055 #define ARROW_BTSP_SOLVE_PLAN_CONSTRAINED_SHAKE 3

00073 /****************************************************************************
00074  *  Data Structures
00075  ****************************************************************************/
00076 /**
00077  *  @brief  A lower bound result
00078  */
00079 typedef struct arrow_bound_result
00080 {
00081     int obj_value;          /**< objective value */
00082     double total_time;      /**< total time */
00083 } arrow_bound_result;
00084 
00085 /**
00086  *  @brief  Binary tree data structure.
00087  */
00088 typedef struct arrow_bintree
00089 {
00090     struct arrow_bintree_node *root_node;   /**< root node of tree */
00091     int size;                               /**< size of tree */
00092 } arrow_bintree;
00093 
00094 /**
00095  *  @brief  Binary tree node.
00096  */
00097 typedef struct arrow_bintree_node
00098 {
00099     int data;                               /**< data contained in node */
00100     int has_left_node;                      /**< true if left node exists */
00101     int has_right_node;                     /**< true if right node exists */
00102     struct arrow_bintree_node *left_node;   /**< left node */
00103     struct arrow_bintree_node *right_node;  /**< right node */
00104 } arrow_bintree_node;
00105 
00106 /**
00107  *  @brief  Problem data structure.
00108  */
00109 typedef struct arrow_problem
00110 {
00111     int size;           /**< problem size */
00112     int symmetric;      /**< indicates if cost matrix is symmetric */
00113     CCdatagroup data;   /**< Concorde data structure for problem. */
00114     int shallow;        /**< indicates use of shallow copy of data */
00115     char name[64];      /**< name of problem (can be NULL) */
00116     
00117     /**
00118      *  @brief  Returns the cost between node i and node j.
00119      *  @param  this [in] problem data
00120      *  @param  i [in] node i
00121      *  @param  j [in] node j
00122      *  @return cost between node i and j.
00123      */
00124     int 
00125     (*get_cost)(struct arrow_problem *this, int i, int j);
00126 } arrow_problem;
00127 
00128 /**
00129  *  @brief  Problem information data structure.
00130  */
00131 typedef struct arrow_problem_info
00132 {
00133     int *cost_list;         /**< sorted list of unique costs from problem. */
00134     int cost_list_length;   /**< length of cost list. */
00135     int min_cost;           /**< smallest cost in problem. */
00136     int max_cost;           /**< largest cost in problem. */
00137 } arrow_problem_info;
00138 
00139 /**
00140  *  @brief  LK algorithm parameters
00141  */
00142 typedef struct arrow_tsp_lk_params
00143 {
00144     int random_restarts;    /**< the number of random restarts to perform */
00145     int stall_count;        /**< the max number of 4-swap kicks to perform
00146                                  without making progress */
00147     int kicks;              /**< the number of 4-swap kicks to perform */
00148     int kick_type;          /**< the type of kick: one of CC_LK_RANDOM_KICK, 
00149                                  CC_LK_GEOMETRIC_KICK, or CC_LK_CLOSE_KICK;
00150                                  see Concorde documentation for more info */
00151     double time_bound;      /**< stop after this running time reached; set to 
00152                                  0 to have no time bound, must be positive */
00153     double length_bound;    /**< stop after finding tour of this length; must
00154                                  be non-negative */
00155     int *initial_tour;      /**< initial tour (may be NULL) */
00156 } arrow_tsp_lk_params;
00157 
00158 /**
00159  *  @brief  TSP result (including result from LK heuristic)
00160  */
00161 typedef struct arrow_tsp_result
00162 {
00163     int found_tour;         /**< true if a tour was found, false otherwise */
00164     double obj_value;       /**< objective value (tour length) */
00165     int *tour;              /**< tour that was found in node-node format */
00166     double total_time;      /**< total time */
00167 } arrow_tsp_result;
00168 
00169 /**
00170  *  @brief  BTSP result
00171  */
00172 typedef struct arrow_btsp_result
00173 {
00174     int found_tour;         /**< true if a tour was found, false otherwise */
00175     int obj_value;          /**< objective value (largest cost in tour) */
00176     double tour_length;     /**< length of the tour found */
00177     int *tour;              /**< tour that was found in node-node format */
00178     int optimal;            /**< indicates if the solution is optimal */
00179     int bin_search_steps;   /**< number of steps in binary search */
00180     int linkern_attempts;   /**< number of calls to LK heuristic */
00181     double linkern_time;    /**< total time calling LK heuristic */
00182     int exact_attempts;     /**< number of calls to exact TSP solver */
00183     double exact_time;      /**< total time calling exact TSP solver */
00184     double total_time;      /**< total time */
00185 } arrow_btsp_result;
00186 
00187 /**
00188  *  @brief  BTSP Cost matrix function definition
00189  */
00190 typedef struct arrow_btsp_fun
00191 {
00192     void *data;             /**< data required by function */
00193     int shallow;            /**< indicates use of shallow copy of data */
00194     double feasible_length; /**< the length of a feasible tour (normally 0) */
00195     
00196     /**
00197      *  @brief  Applies the function to the given problem
00198      *  @param  fun [in] function structure
00199      */
00200     int 
00201     (*apply)(struct arrow_btsp_fun *fun, arrow_problem *old_problem,
00202              int delta, arrow_problem *new_problem);
00203     
00204     /**
00205      *  @brief  Destructs the function structure
00206      *  @param  fun [out] function structure
00207      */
00208     void 
00209     (*destruct)(struct arrow_btsp_fun *fun);
00210     
00211     /**
00212      *  @brief  Determines if the given tour is feasible or not.
00213      *  @param  fun [in] function structure
00214      *  @param  problem [in] the problem to check against
00215      *  @param  delta [in] the delta parameter
00216      *  @param  tour_length [in] the length of the given tour
00217      *  @param  tour [in] the tour in node-node format
00218      *  @return ARROW_TRUE if the tour is feasible, ARROW_FALSE if not
00219      */
00220     int
00221     (*feasible)(struct arrow_btsp_fun *fun, arrow_problem *problem,
00222                 int delta, double tour_length, int *tour);
00223 } arrow_btsp_fun;
00224 
00225 /**
00226  *  @brief  BTSP feasibility solve step plan
00227  */
00228 typedef struct arrow_btsp_solve_plan
00229 {
00230     int plan_type;                 /**< the type of plan (see macros) */
00231     int use_exact_solver;          /**< use exact TSP solver? */
00232     arrow_btsp_fun fun;            /**< the cost matrix function to apply */
00233     arrow_tsp_lk_params lk_params; /**< LK params to use */
00234     int upper_bound_update;        /**< Check for better upper bound?*/
00235     int attempts;                  /**< number of attempts to perform */
00236 } arrow_btsp_solve_plan;
00237 
00238 /**
00239  *  @brief  BTSP algorithm parameters
00240  */
00241 typedef struct arrow_btsp_params
00242 {
00243     int confirm_sol;                /**< confirm sol. with exact solver? */
00244     int supress_ebst;               /**< supress EBST-heuristic? */
00245     int find_short_tour;            /**< find short BSTP tour? */
00246     int lower_bound;                /**< initial lower bound */
00247     int upper_bound;                /**< initial upper bound */
00248     int num_steps;                  /**< the number of solve plan steps */
00249     arrow_btsp_solve_plan *steps;   /**< solve plan steps */
00250 } arrow_btsp_params;
00251 
00252 /**
00253  *  @brief  Program options structure
00254  */
00255 typedef struct arrow_option
00256 {
00257     char short_option;              /**< short option (flag) */
00258     const char *long_option;        /**< long option */
00259     const char *help_message;       /**< help message to display for option */
00260     int data_type;                  /**< one of ARROW_OPTION_INT, 
00261                                          ARROW_OPTION_DOUBLE, 
00262                                         ARROW_OPTION_STRING */
00263     void *data_ptr;          /**< pointer to variable to hold parameter */
00264     int opt_required;       /**< if true ensures option is present */
00265     int arg_required;       /**< if true, ensures argument for parameter
00266                                  passed, otherwise puts 1 into data_ptr if
00267                                  parameter is present */
00268 } arrow_option;

00273 /**
00274  *  @brief  Solves the 2-max bound (2MB) on the given problem.
00275  *  @param  problem [in] problem data
00276  *  @param  info [in] problem info
00277  *  @param  result [out] 2MB solution
00278  */
00279 int
00280 arrow_2mb_solve(arrow_problem *problem, arrow_bound_result *result);

00294 /****************************************************************************
00295  *  bbssp.c
00296  ****************************************************************************/ 
00297 /**
00298  *  @brief  Solves the bottleneck biconnected spanning subgraph problem 
00299  *          (BBSSP) on the given problem.
00300  *  @param  problem [in] problem data
00301  *  @param  info [in] problem info
00302  *  @param  result [out] BBSSP solution
00303  */
00304 int
00305 arrow_bbssp_solve(arrow_problem *problem, arrow_problem_info *info, 
00306                   arrow_bound_result *result);
00307 
00308 /**
00309  *  @brief  Determines if the graph is biconnected using only edges with costs
00310             less than or equal to the given value.
00311  *  @param  problem [in] problem data
00312  *  @param  max_cost [in] value to check biconnectivity question against
00313  *  @param  result [out] ARROW_TRUE if biconnected, ARROW_FALSE otherwise.
00314  */
00315 int
00316 arrow_bbssp_biconnected(arrow_problem *problem, int max_cost, int *result);

00432 /****************************************************************************
00433  *  btsp_fun.c
00434  ****************************************************************************/
00435 /**
00436  *  @brief  Applies the given function to the given problem to create a new
00437  *          problem.
00438  *  @param  fun [in] function structure
00439  *  @param  old_problem [in] existing problem
00440  *  @param  delta [in] delta parameter
00441  *  @param  new_problem [out] new problem to create
00442  */
00443 int
00444 arrow_btsp_fun_apply(arrow_btsp_fun *fun, arrow_problem *old_problem, 
00445                      int delta, arrow_problem *new_problem);
00446  
00447 /**
00448  *  @brief  Destructs a function structure
00449  *  @param  fun [out] function structure
00450  */
00451 void
00452 arrow_btsp_fun_destruct(arrow_btsp_fun *fun);
00453 
00454 /**
00455  *  @brief  Basic BTSP to TSP function.
00456  *  @param  shallow [in] ARROW_TRUE for shallow copy, ARROW_FALSE for deep
00457  *  @param  fun [out] function structure
00458  */
00459 int
00460 arrow_btsp_fun_basic(int shallow, arrow_btsp_fun *fun);
00461 
00462 /**
00463  *  @brief  Basic BTSP to TSP function for asymmetric problem instances.
00464  *  @param  shallow [in] ARROW_TRUE for shallow copy, ARROW_FALSE for deep
00465  *  @param  fun [out] function structure
00466  */
00467 int
00468 arrow_btsp_fun_basic_atsp(int shallow, arrow_btsp_fun *fun);
00469 
00470 /**
00471  *  @brief  Constrained BTSP to TSP function
00472  *  @param  shallow [in] ARROW_TRUE for shallow copy, ARROW_FALSE for deep
00473  *  @param  feasible_length [in] length of feasible tour
00474  *  @param  infinity [in] value to use as "infinity"
00475  *  @param  fun [out] function structure
00476  */
00477 int
00478 arrow_btsp_fun_constrained(int shallow, double feasible_length, int infinity,
00479                            arrow_btsp_fun *fun);
00480 
00481 /**
00482  *  @brief  Constrained "Shake" BTSP to TSP function
00483  *  @param  shallow [in] ARROW_TRUE for shallow copy, ARROW_FALSE for deep
00484  *  @param  feasible_length [in] length of feasible tour
00485  *  @param  infinity [in] value to use as "infinity"
00486  *  @param  rand_min [in] minimum random value to generate
00487  *  @param  rand_max [in] maximum random value to generate
00488  *  @param  problem [in] the problem the shake is based upon
00489  *  @param  info [in] information about the original problem
00490  *  @param  fun [out] function structure
00491  */
00492 int
00493 arrow_btsp_fun_constrained_shake(int shallow, double feasible_length, 
00494                                  int infinity, int rand_min, int rand_max,
00495                                  arrow_problem *problem, 
00496                                  arrow_problem_info *info, 
00497                                  arrow_btsp_fun *fun);

00515 int

00521  */
00522 void

00524 
00525 /**
00526  *  @brief  Builds ordered cost list and finds min/max cost in a problem.
00527  *  @param  problem [in] problem data structure
00528  *  @param  info [out] problem info data structure
00529  */
00530 int
00531 arrow_problem_info_get(arrow_problem *problem, arrow_problem_info *info);
00532

00538 arrow_problem_info_destruct(arrow_problem_info *info);

00540 /**
00541  *  @brief  Prints out information about a problem.

00544 void

00546 
00547 /**
00548  *  @brief  Retrieves cost between nodes i and j
00549  *  @param  problem [in] pointer to arrow_problem structure
00550  *  @param  i [in] id of starting node
00551  *  @param  j [in] id of ending node
00552  *  @return cost between node i and node j
00553  */
00554 inline int 
00555 arrow_problem_get_cost(arrow_problem *problem, int i, int j);
00556 
00557 /**
00558  *  @brief  Reads a TSPLIB tour file
00559  *  @param  file_name [in] the TSPLIB tour file to read
00560  *  @param  size [in] the number of cities in the tour
00561  *  @param  tour [out] an array to hold the tour in node-node format
00562  */
00563 int
00564 arrow_problem_read_tour(char *file_name, int size, int *tour);
00565 
00566 /**
00567  *      @brief  Transforms an asymmetric BTSP problem of n nodes into a symmetric
00568  *                      BTSP problem with 2n nodes.
00569  *  @param  old_problem [in] the asymmetric problem
00570  *      @param  infinity [in] value to use as "infinity"
00571  *      @param  new_problem [out] the new symmetric problem
00572  */
00573 int
00574 arrow_problem_abtsp_to_sbtsp(arrow_problem *old_problem, int infinity, 
00575                              arrow_problem *new_problem);

00586 int

00593 void
00594 arrow_tsp_result_destruct(arrow_tsp_result *result);
00595 
00596 /**
00597  *  @brief  Sets default parameters for Lin-Kernighan heuristic:
00598  *              - random_restarts = 0
00599  *              - stall_count = problem->size
00600  *              - kicks = (problem->size / 2), at least 500
00601  *              - kick_type = CC_LK_GEOMETRIC_KICK
00602  *              - time_bound = 0.0
00603  *              - length_bound = 0.0
00604  *              - initial_tour = NULL
00605  *  @param  problem [in] problem to solve
00606  *  @param  params [out] LK parameters structure
00607  */
00608 void
00609 arrow_tsp_lk_params_init(arrow_problem *problem, arrow_tsp_lk_params *params);
00610 
00611 /**
00612  *  @brief  Destructs a LK parameters structure.
00613  *  @param  result [out] LK parameters structure
00614  */
00615 void 
00616 arrow_tsp_lk_params_destruct(arrow_tsp_lk_params *params);
00617 
00618 /**
00619  *  @brief  Solves TSP with Concorde's exact solver.
00620  *  @param  problem [in] problem to solve
00621  *  @param  in_tour [in] an initial tour (can be NULL)
00622  *  @param  result [out] TSP solution
00623  */
00624 int 
00625 arrow_tsp_exact_solve(arrow_problem *problem, int *initial_tour, 
00626                       arrow_tsp_result *result);
00627 
00628 /**
00629  *  @brief  Solves TSP with Concorde's Lin-Kernighan heuristic.
00630  *  @param  problem [in] problem to solve
00631  *  @param  params [in] Lin-Kernighan params (can be NULL)
00632  *  @param  result [out] TSP solution
00633  */                  
00634 int
00635 arrow_tsp_lk_solve(arrow_problem *problem, arrow_tsp_lk_params *params,
00636                    arrow_tsp_result *result);

00715  *              non-increasing order)

00718  *  @param  pos [out] the index where the element can be found in the array
